basics.name: Joel Schwarzmann
basics.label: Product & Engineering Leadership | Data Platforms | Developer Experience
basics.summary: Builder of data & ML platforms and developer tooling. Combines hands-on engineering with product leadership to ship secure, interoperable systems. Translates complex technical concepts for audiences across the business; passionate about developing platforms and products users love to use.

work.summary: Spearheading GCP-native data platform serving women with personalised, clinically-validated healthcare insights directly impacting patient outcomes.
highlights: Delivered production platform integrating EHR, genomics, and wearable data streams.
Established FHIR-compliant architecture with interoperability as a core feature, including an MCP layer to enable secure LLM use cases (e.g., triage, coaching).
Laid the groundwork for exposing our research platform to our first external pharmaceutical partner.
led product discovery for exposing our research platform to our first external pharmaceutical partner.
Operated in a seed-stage context, spanning product, platform, and engineering execution.

work.summary: Strategic and technical advisor across portfolio companies on data, ML, and AI platforms.
highlights: Guided ML/AI capability development, engineering standards and scalable data infrastructure across biotech, pharmaceuticals, and healthcare portfolio companies.
Led vendor assessments and selections (e.g., Vanta, Dagster, Linear, Miro, Posthog).

work.summary: Product leader for developer tooling and durable ML delivery; stewarded open source and incubated multiple products end-to-end.
highlights: Stewarded Kedro (10.5k â˜…) through LF AI & Data incubation to graduation, Led a customer-driven research initiative that identified and addressed key pain points in Kedro's configuration experience, resulting in a comprehensive overhaul that significantly reduced configuration overhead; continue to serve on the Kedro Technical Steering Committee (TSC).
Incubated an internal multi-tenant 'ML Models as a Service' platform from Aug 2023 to initial client deployments in 2024.
Created Alloy, an internal build tool to compose Kedro projects from reusable building blocks; simplified packaging, CI/CD, and testing and drove org-wide adoption.
Led cross-functional teams to drive consistency and raise engineering excellence across a global ML cross-industry product portfolio.
Defined privacy-preserving product telemetry standards and rollout practices.
Ran developer community events and Demo Days to drive reuse and collaboration.

work.summary: Forward-deployed Data Engineer delivering production ML across pharma, manufacturing, insurance, and motorsport.
highlights: Built reinforcement-learning-driven race strategy software for a championship-winning Formula E team; led Phase 1 (Engineering) and Phase 2 (Product).
Designed feature engineering and deployment pipelines across vaccine production, diabetes patient journeys, and motor insurance pricing.

work.summary: Delivered data-driven investigations across fraud, disputes, and trade surveillance; built SQL/Python toolkits.
highlights: Analysed Bloomberg communications related to LIBOR front-running.
Resolved creditor disputes and managed decommissioning projects post-Lehman Brothers bankruptcy.
Led development of graph-database-powered market surveillance tooling.

projects.name: Kedro (LF AI & Data)
projects.summary: Kedro is a toolbox for production-ready data science. It uses software engineering best practices to help you create data engineering and data science pipelines that are reproducible, maintainable, and modular.

awards.title: Best Final Year Student
awards.awarder: University of Birmingham, School of Computer Science

publications.name: Reasoning Over Pre-training: Evaluating LLM Performance and Augmentation in Women's Health
